definition: to turn over/to flip over/to overturn/to rummage through/to translate/to decode/to double/to climb over or into/to cross
generic word for peoples or states of south China or south Asia at different historical periods/abbr. for Vietnam 越南
to exceed/to climb over/to surpass/the more... the more

sentences.english: Over 11 years, he traveled across deserts and mountains.
sentences.chinese: 在這11年間，他穿過沙漠，翻越高山。

sentences.english: To get there involved crossing a number of mountains.
sentences.chinese: 要到達那裏，必須翻越許多道山。

sentences.english: He fell on the idea while looking through a book.
sentences.chinese: 他在翻越一本書時偶然產生了這個想法。

sentences.english: Some even put themselves at risk taking short cuts by climbing dividers in the middle of roads.
sentences.chinese: 還有些人爲了省事甚至冒險翻越路中間的防護欄。

sentences.english: If we can't go over the mountain we must go round it.
sentences.chinese: 如果我們不能翻越這座山，我們得繞過去。

sentences.english: These tools will help you get over the moat.
sentences.chinese: 這些手段有助於你翻越城壕。

sentences.english: The road passes over a steep mountain.
sentences.chinese: 這條路翻越一架陡峭的高山。

sentences.english: I climbed over fences and trudged through mud that stuck to my shoes.
sentences.chinese: 我還翻越過圍牆，並且在粘住鞋子的泥漿裏艱難跋涉。

sentences.english: Climbing the steep mountain caused our car to heat up.
sentences.chinese: 由於翻越高山峻嶺，我們的汽車引擎發熱了。

sentences.english: Their first problem was crossing over a huge mountain.
sentences.chinese: 他們首先面臨的問題是必須翻越一座高山。

sentences.english: How can I get past that invisible wall?
sentences.chinese: 我如何才能翻越這道無形的牆呢？

sentences.english: I’ve even had people flip me off.
sentences.chinese: 我甚至讓人們從我身上翻越過去。

sentences.english: After climbing across the toweringly steep mountains, our army finally reached their destination.
sentences.chinese: 隊伍翻越崇山峻嶺，終於到達了目的地。

definition: to climb over/to get over (difficulties)/to scale/to surmount
to climb/to pull oneself up/to clamber/to scale/fig. to forge ahead in the face of hardships and danger
to pass over mountains ridges (idiom); fig. hardships of the journey
to cross over/to transcend/to cover distance/to overcome/to rise above
